009package imagingbook.common.mser;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianFilter;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.Translation2D;
020import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
021import imagingbook.common.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
022import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
023import imagingbook.common.mser.components.Component;
024
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * Provides functionality to extract local affine frames from a given image.
029 * Assumes that the specified image has a white background (255) and black (0) objects.
030 * See Section 26.5 of [1] for a detailed description.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @see AffineMapping2D
037 * @see ImageMapper
038 */
039public class LocalAffineFrameExtractor {
040        
041        private static InterpolationMethod interpolMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
042        
043        private final ImageProcessor sourceIp;
044        private final int m;                                    // size of frame to extract (W = H = 2 m + 1)
045        private final double s;                                 // size ratio between outer and inner ellipse
046        private final boolean useAntiAliasingFilter;    
047        
048        /**
049         * Full constructor.
050         * @param sourceIp the image to extract frames from
051         * @param m size of the (square) frames to extract (W = H = 2 m + 1)
052         * @param s size ratio between outer and inner ellipse
053         * @param useAntiAliasingFilter turn anti-aliasing filter on or off
054         */
055        public LocalAffineFrameExtractor(ImageProcessor sourceIp, int m, double s, boolean useAntiAliasingFilter) {
056                this.sourceIp = sourceIp;
057                this.m = m;
058                this.s = s;
059                this.useAntiAliasingFilter = useAntiAliasingFilter;
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Short constructor.
064         * @param sourceIp the image to extract frames from
065         * @param m size of the (square) frames to extract (W = H = 2 m + 1)
066         */
067        public LocalAffineFrameExtractor(ImageProcessor sourceIp, int m) {
068                this(sourceIp, m, 1.5, true);
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Extracts a single local-affine frame for the specified
073         * MSER component.
074         * The extracted image has the same type as the original source image
075         * (passed to the constructor).
076         * 
077         * @param mser a MSER component
078         * @return the local-affine frame (instance of {@link ImageProcessor})
079         */
080        public ImageProcessor getLocalAffineFrame(Component<MserData> mser) {
081                MserData props = mser.getProperties();
082                double[] xc = props.getCenter().toDoubleArray(); //{mu10, mu01};
083                double[][] S = props.getCovarianceMatrix();
084                
085                EigenDecomposition ed = new EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(S));
086                RealMatrix V = ed.getV();
087                RealMatrix D = ed.getD();
088                
089                for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
090                        D.setEntry(i, i, Math.sqrt(D.getEntry(i, i)));
091                }
092                
093                RealMatrix A = V.multiply(D).scalarMultiply(2.0 * s / m);
094                double detA = Matrix.determinant2x2(A.getData());
095
096                if (detA < 0) { // reflection
097                        RealMatrix reflect = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {{1,0},{0,-1}});
098                        A = A.multiply(reflect);        // undo reflection!!
099                }
100                
101                ImageProcessor ip2 = sourceIp.duplicate();
102                ip2.invert(); // makes the background black, objects white
103                
104                if (useAntiAliasingFilter) {
105                        GeometricEllipse ellipse = props.getEllipse();
106                        double dMax = s * ellipse.ra / m;       // scale ratio
107                        double sigma = 0;
108                        if (dMax > 1.5) {       // down-scaling, sample width increases by factor dScale
109                                sigma = (dMax - 1) * 0.5;       // factor 0.5 is ad hoc (full dMax blurs too much)
110                        }
111                        if (sigma > 0) {
112                                GaussianFilter gf = new GaussianFilter(sigma);
113                                gf.applyTo(ip2);
114                        }
115                }
116                
117                int frameSize = 2 * m + 1;
118                ImageProcessor laf = sourceIp.createProcessor(frameSize, frameSize);
119                
120                AffineMapping2D T1 = new Translation2D(-m, -m);
121                AffineMapping2D AA = new AffineMapping2D(A.getData());
122                AffineMapping2D T2 = new Translation2D(xc);
123                
124                AffineMapping2D M = T1.concat(AA).concat(T2);
125                ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(M, null, interpolMethod);
126                
127                mapper.map(ip2, laf);
128                
129                laf.invert(); // makes background white again           
130                return laf;
131        }
132
133}
